SEARCH
Package com.example.atlasevents

Class NotificationTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.atlasevents.NotificationTest
public class NotificationTest extends Object
Unit tests for the Notification class. Tests the data model for notifications including construction, getters, setters, and serialization/deserialization behavior.

  • Constructor Details

    • NotificationTest

      public NotificationTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Sets up test fixtures before each test method. Creates a new Notification instance with test data.

    • testConstructor_SetsAllFieldsCorrectly

      public void testConstructor_SetsAllFieldsCorrectly()
      Tests the parameterized constructor sets all fields correctly. Verifies that all provided parameters are properly assigned and the notification is initialized as unread.

    • testDefaultConstructor_CreatesValidInstance

      public void testDefaultConstructor_CreatesValidInstance()
      Tests the default constructor creates a valid empty notification. This is primarily used by Firestore for deserialization and should not throw any exceptions when called.

    • testNotificationId_GetterAndSetter_WorkCorrectly

      public void testNotificationId_GetterAndSetter_WorkCorrectly()
      Tests notification ID getter and setter methods. Verifies that the notification ID can be set and retrieved correctly.

    • testReadStatus_GetterAndSetter_WorkCorrectly

      public void testReadStatus_GetterAndSetter_WorkCorrectly()
      Tests read status getter and setter methods. Verifies that the read status can be toggled and retrieved correctly.

    • testCreatedAt_GetterAndSetter_WorkCorrectly

      public void testCreatedAt_GetterAndSetter_WorkCorrectly()
      Tests createdAt timestamp getter and setter methods. Verifies that the creation timestamp can be set and retrieved correctly.

    • testAllStringFields_GetterAndSetter_WorkCorrectly

      public void testAllStringFields_GetterAndSetter_WorkCorrectly()
      Tests all string field getters and setters work correctly. Verifies that each string field can be updated and retrieved properly.

    • testNullValues_AreHandledCorrectly

      public void testNullValues_AreHandledCorrectly()
      Tests that null values are handled properly in setters. Verifies that setting null values doesn't cause exceptions and getters return null as expected.
